org.platanios.learn.combination.error

Class OptimizationProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.combination.error.OptimizationProblem

  • class OptimizationProblem
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the numerical optimization problem that needs to be solved in order to estimate error rates of several approximations to a single function, by using only the agreement rates of those functions on an unlabeled set of data, for use with the KNITRO solver.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AgreementRatesPowerSetVector agreementRates
      The agreement rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the sample agreement rates that are used for defining the equality constraints of the problem).
      private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> constraintsJacobian
      A list where each entry is an array with three elements: (i) a constraint index, (ii) an error rate index and (iii) the derivative of the constraint specified in (i) with respect to the error rate specified in (ii).
      private ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates
      The error rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).
      private com.google.common.collect.BiMap<java.lang.Integer,int[]> inequalityConstraintsIndexes
      A map containing the error rates array indices that correspond to each inequality constraint.
      private ObjectiveFunction objectiveFunction
      An instance of the class containing methods that compute the objective function that we wish to minimize, its gradients with respect to the optimization variables and its Hessian with respect to the optimization variables.
      private double[] optimizationConstraints
      Array with the values of the constraints of the optimization problem (both inequality and equality constraints).
      private double[] optimizationConstraintsJacobian
      Array with the values of the constraints derivatives (or, equivalently, the constraints Jacobian).
      private double[] optimizationHessian
      The Hessian of the Lagrangian.
      private double[] optimizationObjective
      Array with the value of the objective function (it is defined as an array but it holds a single value).
      private double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients
      Array with the values of the objective function derivatives.
      private double[] optimizationVariables
      Array with the variables with respect to which the optimization is performed.
      private com.ziena.knitro.KnitroJava solver
      The actual KNITRO solver instance.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OptimizationProblem(int numberOfFunctions, int highestOrder, ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates, AgreementRatesPowerSetVector agreementRates, ObjectiveFunctionType objectiveFunctionType)
      Initializes all parameters needed for performing the optimization procedure using the KNITRO solver.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void computeConstraints(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationConstraints)
      Computes the constraints values at a particular point.
      private void computeConstraintsGradients(double[] optimizationConstraintsJacobian)
      Computes the first derivatives of the constraints at a particular point (the constraints are actually linear in this case and so their derivatives values are constant).
      (package private) double[] solve()
      Solves the numerical optimization problem and returns the error rates estimates in double[] format.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • errorRates

        private final ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates
        The error rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).

      • agreementRates

        private final AgreementRatesPowerSetVector agreementRates
        The agreement rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the sample agreement rates that are used for defining the equality constraints of the problem).

      • inequalityConstraintsIndexes

        private final com.google.common.collect.BiMap<java.lang.Integer,int[]> inequalityConstraintsIndexes
        A map containing the error rates array indices that correspond to each inequality constraint. It is used in order to make the inequality constraints calculation fast.

      • constraintsJacobian

        private final java.util.List<java.lang.Integer[]> constraintsJacobian
        A list where each entry is an array with three elements: (i) a constraint index, (ii) an error rate index and (iii) the derivative of the constraint specified in (i) with respect to the error rate specified in (ii). It is used to make the constraints Jacobian calculation fast.

      • solver

        private com.ziena.knitro.KnitroJava solver
        The actual KNITRO solver instance.

      • objectiveFunction

        private ObjectiveFunction objectiveFunction
        An instance of the class containing methods that compute the objective function that we wish to minimize, its gradients with respect to the optimization variables and its Hessian with respect to the optimization variables.

      • optimizationVariables

        private double[] optimizationVariables
        Array with the variables with respect to which the optimization is performed. That is, the array with the error rates.

      • optimizationObjective

        private double[] optimizationObjective
        Array with the value of the objective function (it is defined as an array but it holds a single value).

      • optimizationConstraints

        private double[] optimizationConstraints
        Array with the values of the constraints of the optimization problem (both inequality and equality constraints).

      • optimizationObjectiveGradients

        private double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients
        Array with the values of the objective function derivatives.

      • optimizationConstraintsJacobian

        private double[] optimizationConstraintsJacobian
        Array with the values of the constraints derivatives (or, equivalently, the constraints Jacobian).

      • optimizationHessian

        private double[] optimizationHessian
        The Hessian of the Lagrangian.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OptimizationProblem

        OptimizationProblem(int numberOfFunctions,
                    int highestOrder,
                    ErrorRatesPowerSetVector errorRates,
                    AgreementRatesPowerSetVector agreementRates,
                    ObjectiveFunctionType objectiveFunctionType)
        Initializes all parameters needed for performing the optimization procedure using the KNITRO solver. It also instantiates the solver and makes sure that JVM can "communicate" with the KNITRO solver native libraries.
        Parameters:
        numberOfFunctions - The number of function approximations/classifiers whose error rates we want to estimate.
        highestOrder - The highest order of agreement rates to consider and equivalently, the highest order of error rates to try and estimate.
        errorRates - The error rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the power set indexing information used to index the error rates over all possible power sets of functions as a simple one-dimensional array).
        agreementRates - The agreement rates structure used for this optimization (this structure contains the sample agreement rates that are used for defining the equality constraints of the problem).
        objectiveFunctionType - The type of objective function to minimize (e.g. minimize dependency, scaled dependency, etc.).

    • Method Detail

      • computeConstraints

        private void computeConstraints(double[] optimizationVariables,
                                double[] optimizationConstraints)
        Computes the constraints values at a particular point.
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the objective function and the constraints.
        optimizationConstraints - The constraints values to set for the given point.

      • computeConstraintsGradients

        private void computeConstraintsGradients(double[] optimizationConstraintsJacobian)
        Computes the first derivatives of the constraints at a particular point (the constraints are actually linear in this case and so their derivatives values are constant).
        Parameters:
        optimizationConstraintsJacobian - The constraints Jacobian (in sparse/vector form) to modify.

      • solve

        double[] solve()
        Solves the numerical optimization problem and returns the error rates estimates in double[] format.
        Returns:
        The error rates estimates in a double[] format.
